p.s: On 10th of July 2018, the EU commissioner Michel Barnier held a speech at the European American Chamber of Commerce.

In the given excerpt of the speech he talks about the impact of the Brexit on the UK antand the EU, but he also talks about a possible bright future of the relationship between UK and EU, mostly in economy.
He wants to make the people aware of this possible bright future and how to achieve it.
The excerpt begins with him saying that he regrets the Brexit and that the Brexit will have a cost.
He starts explaining these costs with by reminding the listener of the decision of the UK to leave the European Union's Single Market and says that it will create new disagreements in trade.
He continues by explaining how this will affect many economic sectors and names some of them.
He also saysays that UK and EU will both be damaged by the Brexit, but the UK way more.
This leads him to give buisnessesbusinesses the advice of analysing the effect the Brexit might have on them and also to prepare for a no deal scenario.
Next he states that in his point of view the UK should have a close relationship to the EU, also in financial services.
He explains that in the EU, for free movement of capital is also open to third countries.
Next he makes clear that he thinks the Free Trade Agreement with the UK should include rights in financial service with EU rules appplying.
He also says that the EU is the most open legal system for financial service.
He finishes his speech with the promise of the EU remaining the most open market in the world and not changing this because of the Brexit.
